div.l: And com a gayn And com a gayn And gan a wake and went hir oute to pisse
And com agayn and gan the Cradill mysse
And gropid here and ther but sche fond noon
Allas quoth sche I had al most mysgon
I had al most gon to the Clerkis bed
Ey benedicite thanne hadde I foule spedd
And forthe sche goth til sche the Cradil fond
Sche gropith all wey forthere with hir hond
And fond the bed and thought nought but god
Bi cause that the Cradill bi hit stode
And ne wist wher sche was for hit was dirke
But faire and wele sche crep in b b to the clerke
And lith full stille and wolde haue caught a slepe
With in a while Iohn the Clerke vp lepe
And on this gode wif he leyth on so sore
So merie a fitte ne had sche nought ful yore
He prikith harde and depe as he wer mad
This ioly lif han thise ij Clerkis ledde
Till that the thridde koc by gan to synge
Aleyn wex wery in the dawnyng
For he had swonkyn al the longe nyght
And saide fare well malyne swete wight
The day is comen I may no lenger bide
But eủere mo wher so I go othir ride
I am thyn awne clerke so haue I sele
Now dere lemman quoth sche fare right well
But or thou goo o thing I wille the telle
Whenne thou goste homward by the mylle
Right at the entre of the dore by hynde
Thou schalt a kake of half a buschel fynde
That was I makid of thyn owne mele
Which that I help my self for to stele
And gode lemman god the saue and kepe
And with that worde al moste sche ganne to wepe
Aleyn vp rist and thought or hit dawe
I wille go crepen in by my felawe
And fonde the Cradill with his hand anon
Bi god thought hee al wrong I haue mysgon
Myn hede is toty of my swynke to nyght
That makith me that I go nat a right
I wott well by the Cradill I haue mys go
Here lithe the myller and his wif also
And forth he goth on twenty deuelway
